scenario:
Bristol Myers Squibb (BMY) has a high dividend yield of 2.08% and is a top healthcare company with a diverse business. The company has been investing in its drug development pipeline, with recent FDA approvals for Cobenfy and Breyanzi, which could generate significant revenue. BMY is trading at less than 9 times its projected earnings next year and has a high dividend yield of 4.2%. 

Target (TGT) has a dividend yield of 1.53% and is a Dividend King, having raised its payouts for more than 50 consecutive years. Despite a decline in share price by 34% in the past three years, the company has been able to grow its earnings by more than 8% over the past three quarters. Target is trading at a forward price-to-earnings multiple of just under 15 and has a stable business and an excellent track record.

Suncor Energy (SU) has a dividend yield of -0.89% but is a solid dividend stock to consider for portfolio diversification. The company is a big player in the oil and gas industry and has been a reliable investment, rising by nearly 40% in value over the past three years. Suncor has generated significant operating profit and is investing in its operations to increase production and lower costs. The stock is trading at a forward price-to-earnings multiple of 14 and provides investors with a solid payout.
